section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Attorney" means an individual admitted to practice law by the Court of Appeals of the State.
"Law firm" means an association of attorneys in a law partnership, professional corporation, sole proprietorship, or other business entity who:
"Title agency" means a business entity, other than a law firm, formed for the primary purpose of soliciting, procuring, or negotiating title insurance contracts and providing settlement services.
"Title agency" includes a sole proprietor, partnership, or corporation.

text.section: Subject to this section, the Commissioner may issue a limited lines license to an attorney who solicits, procures, or negotiates title insurance contracts to act as a title insurance producer.

All licensing provisions of this subtitle apply to:
an attorney who solicits, procures, or negotiates title insurance contracts; and
title agencies even if the title agency is established or owned by an attorney or an association of attorneys.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this subtitle:
the licensing, bonding, education, experience, and examination requirements of this subtitle relating to title insurance producers do not apply to law firms; and
except as otherwise provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, the bonding, education, experience, and examination requirements of this subtitle relating to title insurance producers do not apply to attorneys.
The bonding requirements of this subtitle are applicable to:
an attorney or an association of attorneys who own, operate, or share an interest in a title agency; and
an attorney who is employed by a title agency as a title insurance producer.
